lead_paragraph: Last month, The New York Times reported in separate articles that the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees had spent $7.9 million, $5 million and $91 million on Tuesday's elections, while The Wall Street Journal reported that the spending was actually $87.5 million. It would seem impossible that all of these numbers could be right. But it is possible they are. The question is how you count spending.
snippet: The Times and The Wall Street Journal report different levels of spending by one union. But it is possible the varying figures are all correct.

headline.main: The Complexities of Campaign Spending, and In Adding It All Up

abstract: The Times and The Wall Street Journal report different levels of spending by one union. But it is possible the varying figures are all correct.
